paragraph.paragraph: EiffelEnvision reserves a number of predestined folder names for its projects, which will either be created by you, or by the EiffelEnvision compiler when ../../compiling_projects/compiling_projects.xmlBuilding projects. It is recommended that your projects refrain from using these folders for any other purpose than for which EiffelEnvision has intended them. This is for future protection of your project and its content.

Currently, EiffelEnvision reserves three names for folders located in the projects root location. That is to say, the location when the EiffelEnvision project file (*.eifp) is located.
known_folders.xmlbin_folderbin
known_folders.xmlobj_folderobj
known_folders.xmlresources_folderresources

Short for Binaries, EiffelEnvision retains the name from previous versions of Visual Studio. It serves as the specified deployment location for final compilation unit(s), generated at the end of ../../compiling_projects/index.xmlcompilation, in this case assemblies and their configuration files. The contents of this folder can be used to very quickly deploy compiled projects by simply copying the contents of a ms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/vsintro7/html/vxconBuildConfigurations.htmbuilt configuration folder.

Originally short of Object Files, EiffelEnvision retains the name that veteran Visual Studio developers are accustomed to, as do other languages such as Visual C# and Visual Basic .NET. This folder contains all of the intermediate compilation information used by the Eiffel for .NET compiler and EiffelEnvision's ../index.xmlprojects.

This folder is specific to EiffelEnvision. It is the folder used to store all unmanaged resources scripts and resources files to be merged into the unmanaged library generated at compile time. The folder is used to manage a single resource source for all configurations in EiffelEnvision, directly from the Solution Explorer. For more information on the unmanaged section of an EiffelEnvision ../../compiling_projects/compiling_projects.xmlcompilation see the ../../compiling_projects/unmanaged_code.xmlCompiling Unmanaged Code section of this documentation.

If you are importing/converting an existing EiffelStudio project using the ../../eiffelenvision_for_eiffelstudio_developers/conversion_tool/index.xmlEiffelStudio to EiffelEnvision Project Conversion Tool, your EiffelStudio project resource scripts found in this folder will be added to the converted EiffelEnvision project automatically. The tool will also automatically configure the EiffelEnvision project based on the contents of the resources folder.
